intro: Cheiranthus orientalis, commonly known as the oriental wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with similar floral structures. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces bright yellow or orange flowers with four petals. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine layer of white wax, which helps reduce water loss. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adaptable to a variety of soil types.
